thread.title: Japanese Retail Investors Trade Trillions Amid Trump Tumult - WSJ
thread.title_full: Japanese Retail Investors Trade Trillions Amid Trump Tumult - WSJ

author: Suryatapa Bhattacharya
title: Japanese Retail Investors Trade Trillions Amid Trump Tumult - WSJ
text:
Markets Japanese Retail Investors Trade Trillions Amid Trump Tumult Trading volume for dollar-yen contracts has averaged $3.7 trillion a month since November, up by more than a third By Google+ Feb. 23, 2017 2:01 a.m. ET 
TOKYO—Donald Trump’s tumultuous first few months after being elected U.S. president may be stressing policy makers and whipsawing some markets, but Japan’s day traders—a major force in yen trading—are having a blast. 
Japanese retail investors have jumped into yen-dollar trading in greater numbers after Mr. Trump’s Nov. 8 win, drawn by a constant flow of market-moving news and comments from the new president and his staff, currency... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
